verbs.description: interthread (third-person singular simple present interthreads, present participle interthreading, simple past and past participle interthreaded)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To pass (strands of material) over and under one another to create a fabric; (by analogy) to weave long, narrow objects together.
examples: the interthreading of warp and weft

entries.meaning: (transitive) To alter a fabric by weaving additional strands into it; to bring (two or more things) together like the strands in fabric; to bring (one thing) together (with another thing).
examples: silk fabrics interthreaded with gold and silver

entries.meaning: (transitive) To be present in every part of (something) like strands running through it.
(transitive) To integrate (strands of material into a fabric) by weaving.
examples: […]  Christianity is slowly but steadily, and as surely, interthreading her bright woof-lines into the texture of national and political, as well as social life:

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To be or become woven or twisted together (with something); to be or become inextricably associated like strands woven or twisted together.
examples: an immense lake of ceaselessly interthreading grays and silvers

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To move alternately on either side of people or objects; to weave in and out.
examples: One, two, three, four step forth, and, to and fro,
Now swaying gently in a row,
